greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Least k such that k^(6^n)*(k^(6^n)-1)+1 is prime.
comment: Numbers of the form k^m*(k^m-1)+1 with m > 0, k > 1 may be primes only if m is 3-smooth, because these numbers are Phi(6,k^m) and cyclotomic factorizations apply to any prime divisors >3. This series is a subset of A205506 with only m=6^n.
Numbers of this form are Generalized unique primes. a(6) generates a 306477-digit prime.
example: When k = 88, k^72-k^36+1 is prime. Since this isn't prime for k < 88, a(2) = 88.
results.author: _Serge Batalov_, Aug 14 2014
